p: Not just perennial but also cultured plants are studied in terms of their pharmacological properties. Between cultured plants, the decorative species of Rudbeckia are present in particular or public gardens. Native to North America, Rudbeckia is a flowering plant of the family Asteraceae, found in 25 different perennial, annual, or biennial species. The most common varieties of this plant are Rudbeckia fulgida, Rudbeckia hirta, Rudbeckia laciniata, or Rudbeckia triloba. This last one was reported in Austria in the 1970s, while in Romania, it has been encountered for the first time in Maramures and Neamt counties [ 9].
